translations.translation: Truly your Lord is the Almighty, the Most Merciful.
Yet surely your Lord is mighty and merciful.
Verily your Lord is Immensely Mighty, Most Compassionate.
Your Lord is Majestic and All-merciful.
And indeed your Lord – only He is the Almighty, the Most Merciful.
And verily your Lord, He is indeed the Almighty, the Most Merciful.
And most surely your Lord is the Mighty, the Merciful.
Surely thy Lord, He is the All-mighty, the All-compassionate.
And lo! thy Lord, He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.
Surely your Lord is the Mighty One, the Merciful.
And verily thy Lord? He is the Mighty, the Merciful.
Indeed your Lord is the All-mighty, the All-merciful.
And verily thy Lord is He, the Exalted in Might, Most Merciful.
And verily! Your Lord, He is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
Surely, your Lord is the Almighty, the Most Merciful.
Your Lord is the Almighty, the Merciful.
And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
[26:140] Truly your Lord, He is the Mighty, the Merciful.
(And lo! thy Lord, He is indeed the Mighty) in retribution against the disbelievers, (the Merciful) towards the believers, for He saved them from the wind.

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: { وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ } يا أكمل الرسل { لَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ } الغالب المستقبل بالتصرف في آثار أسمائه وأوصافه بلا مشاركة له في الوجود والإيجاد { ٱلرَّحِيمُ } [الشعراء: 140] بتجلياته اللطيفية الجمالية في إظهار الكائنات المشاهدة في الآفاق والأنفس حسب إمداده وإعانته
